question.name: Question 1
question.text: Who is NOT included in a PCBU's primary duty of care for the health and safety of workers?
question.choices: Employees|Workers the PCBU engages|Workers whose work activities are influenced or directed by the PCBU|Visitors

question.name: Question 2
question.text: What would a PCBU NOT be required to do to fulfil his or her primary duty of care to workers?
question.correctans: Personally supervise workers while they work to ensure they are not exposed to health and safety risks
question.choices: Provide any information, training or supervision necessary to protect workers from health and safety risks|Monitor the health of workers to prevent illness of injury to workers|Provide and maintain safe systems of work|Personally supervise workers while they work to ensure they are not exposed to health and safety risks

question.name: Question 3
question.text: A PCBU has the duty to ensure the safety of customers who enter the workplace. True or false?

question.name: Question 4
question.text: What steps should a PCBU perform to manage health and safety risks?
question.correctans: Identify hazards, assess risk, control risk, review control measures
question.choices: Identify hazards, assess risk, coordinate with HS representatives, review control measures|Identify hazards, assess risk, control risk, review control measures|Identify hazards, assess workers, control risk, review control measures|Ignore hazards, assess workers, control risk, review control measures

question.name: Question 5
question.text: If it is not reasonably practicable to eliminate a WHS risk, what should a PCBU do?
question.correctans: Use a hierarchy of control measures to minimise the risk
question.choices: Use a hierarchy of control measures to minimise the risk|Hold workers liable for the duty to ensure health and safety|Transfer the duty to ensure health and safety to another party |Nothing, the PCBU must eliminate the WHS risk

question.name: Question 6
question.text: What is the last measure in the process of minimising risk?
question.correctans: Provide personal protective equipment for use
question.choices: Provide personal protective equipment for use|Isolating the hazard from people|Putting in place engineering controls|Implementing administrative actions (for example, work procedures)

question.name: Question 7
question.text: Which is true in relation to the assessment of risks?
question.correctans: You should consider what types of harm could arise from each hazard
question.choices: You should consider what types of harm could arise from each hazard|Past incidents should not be taken into account|You should not consider how many people are involved in a task|You should calculate the probability of harm by considering whether it is necessary to perform a task

question.name: Question 8
question.correctans: \u2026 should be supported with workplace training, instruction and information
question.choices: \u2026 should be used only if a risk has been eliminated|\u2026 should be supported with workplace training, instruction and information|\u2026 do not involve any isolation of hazards|\u2026 should only be considered at one level

question.name: Question 9
question.text: When reviewing a control measure, you should consider whether\u2026
question.choices: \u2026 the measure is operating effectively and as intended|\u2026 safety or supervision procedures are being followed|\u2026 the severity and frequency of incidents have decreased|All of the above

question.name: Question 10
question.text: What is NOT a notifiable incident?
question.correctans: New machinery is adopted that may increase health and safety risks to workers
question.choices: An employee suffers burns to their arms, requiring immediate hospital treatment|New machinery is adopted that may increase health and safety risks to workers|A sub-contractor is killed by a falling object at the workplace|A chemical spillage occurs at the workplace, immediately putting workers' health and safety at risk

question.name: Question 11
question.text: Complete the sentence. If a notifiable incident occurs at a workplace\u2026
question.correctans: \u2026 the PCBU must contact the regulator immediately after becoming aware of it
question.choices: \u2026 the PCBU must adopt new control measures for addressing health and safety risks|\u2026 there are no obligations on the PCBU unless someone was killed or seriously injured|\u2026 the PCBU must contact the regulator immediately after becoming aware of it|\u2026 the PCBU must ensure that activities at the workplace proceed as normal until an inspector has arrived

question.name: Question 12
question.correctans: Workers are responsible for learning how to treat themselves with first aid equipment
question.choices: A PCBU must ensure that first aid equipment is provided to the workplace|Workers are responsible for learning how to treat themselves with first aid equipment|A PCBU must prepare and regularly test procedures to be followed in an emergency|Relevant workers must receive information, training and instruction about the planned emergency procedures

question.name: Question 13
question.text: What must a PCBU ensure so that the physical environment of the workplace is safe?
question.correctans: That there is adequate space for work to be performed without risk to health and safety
question.choices: That the condition of the workplace enables people to move around with moderate risk to their health and safety|That the workplace is visually stimulating to create a more pleasant workplace and, as a result, avoid harm to health and safety|That there is adequate space for work to be performed without risk to health and safety|That the PCBU conducts hourly safety checks

question.name: Question 14
question.text: Which statement is false? Any training provided to workers by the PCBU must\u2026
question.correctans: \u2026 be shorter than two hours in duration
question.choices: \u2026 consider the nature of the risks associated with the work |\u2026 consider the nature of work performed by the worker being trained |\u2026 be shorter than two hours in duration|\u2026 consider any control measures that have been implemented to manage risks

question.name: Question 15
question.text: What additional duties do PCBUs have if they are involved in activities that include plant, substances or structures?
question.choices: Designing and manufacturing items to operate without risks to health and safety|Carrying out testing or examination to make sure that items are without risk to health or safety|Taking steps to ensure items imported or supplied are without risk to health and safety|All of the above
